content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle !
A great idea, but perhaps all the different food names with underscores is too much to fiddle with? Just a thought, not criticizing :)

âŒ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: I got confused after reading the following statement.
"If the width of the chimney is 80 centimeters or more, he needs only one minute"

After reading this I assumed if width >= 80 it always takes one minute but input mentions about the total time it takes to reach destination. So it takes extra 1 minute if width >= 80. Isn't it?

If that is the case I suggest to update the description.

The fact the food and drink are always in the same order means we can check for the presence of the whole string "chocolate_chip_cookies hot_milk". 

Shall it be considered one nice optimization ? 
Another way would be to use a non-ordered list of items offered to Santa.  This offers a whole new crazyness : only a drink /a cookie, multiple drinks/cookies, milk before cookie, ....

I like the concept, but I think you need to improve a few things.
 Firstly you need to include the strings for chocolate chip cookies and hot milk in the description, so you can quickly know what to check for.
The first test case should be simple, probably H < 5 or so.
In the constraints section T should be without units, to be consistent with W, elsewhere on CG and because the unit does not matter.
I've also fixed a couple of spelling errors.
I would suggest to add strings `chocolate_chip_cookies` and `hot_milk` to description. I would also suggest parametrizing Santa width.
âœ… Approved the contribution.
This is very good ClashCode, Thank you Miki09 for your efforts
I am grateful for any suggestions how to make this clash of code better.
Make it a little bit more difficult and I think this should okay. Maybe add in a few more variables that may delay Santa.
I changed the whole idea of bringing presents. I made it more realistic and I hope it will be better.ðŸŽ…

"strength" appears to be carrying capacity, in kilograms per hour, but this needs to be explained as it is not a standard unit of measurement. (Imagine being asked "How strong are you?" and replying "I'm 45 kilograms per hour strong"!)

For floating point output, you need to specify the precision and rounding that should be used; you can't just assume that all languages will use the same number of digits. Alternatively, change the output to HH:MM:SS (rounded to the nearest second).

The first test case must be a simple one. 78 lines of input isn't simple.

Typos:
The plural of reindeer is reindeer, not reindeers (goal, input, output and test names)
"represent's strength" -> "represents the strength" (input)
The plural of present is presents, not present's (output)

As pindsz has already said:
- validators and test cases must be different
- "120 reindeers" breaks the "-1<R<120" constraint

This problem seems a bit strange. Are the reindeers bringing 87564 kg of presents to one single location? How does one know how long it takes a reindeer to deliver x kilograms? 

Also note that some of your test cases are equal to your validators and all the constraints are incorrect: you are using the value 0 (for P and S) and 120 (for R).
Thank you for your feedback. You're right.  I will try to fix it.

Thank you for your feedback. I'm learning so much from you guys. I'm only 12 years old and my programming skills and english are elementary. I will have to rethink the whole idea and do it differently.
I've added chocolate chip cookies and hot milk that may delay Santa.
THANK YOU.
Thank you very much.
Thank you for your feedback. I've changed the description. I've put "come down the chimney" instead of "to deliver presents to one destination". I hope it's more clear now.

Thank you for your feedback. 
I know that "donut" or "cake" is better to work with than "chocolate_chip_cookies". But I wanted to be realistic.  I found a research on Santa's likes and it's clear that chocolate chip cookies are number one ðŸ˜€.

Thanks. I assume the chimney is vertical so Santa needs to come down :) It is better to mention that in the description. Otherwise it is not clear that Time (in minutes) in input excludes travel time in chimney!
